template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the {industry} domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the fintech domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.

message.content: Process a new loan application by validating customer data, resolving any credit score shortfalls, updating the CRM and core banking ledger, then disbursing approved funds.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants me to generate a single-sentence prompt for a fintech workflow. Let me break down the requirements: it needs to be realistic, end-to-end, involve multiple tools, have at least one constraint, require system updates, and deliver an outcome—all under 40 words.

Hmm, fintech... maybe something around loan processing? That usually involves checking eligibility, verifying documents, calculating limits, and updating accounts. Need to include a constraint like a credit score threshold. 

How about starting with a customer applying for a loan? The workflow could include validation tools, a constraint resolver for the credit check, updating the CRM and ledger, and finally disbursing funds. 

Wait, the sentence needs to flow smoothly. Let me draft: "Process a new loan application by validating customer data against KYC and credit databases, resolving any credit score shortfalls with manual review, updating the CRM and core banking ledger, then disbursing approved funds." 

Check the word count: 40 words exactly. It covers all the points—multiple tools (KYC, credit databases, CRM, core banking), constraint (credit score shortfall), system updates (CRM and ledger), and outcome (disbursing funds). Yeah, this should work.
